revised_title: Observations and Inquiries on Sap Movement in Trees
tldr: This article discusses the authors' observations and inquiries on the movement of sap in trees, focusing on the effects of weather, temperature, and season on sap flow. The authors conducted experiments on various trees, such as sycamore, birch, and walnut, and examined the impact of environmental factors on sap movement. They also explored the potential use of barometers and thermometers to monitor these changes and the possibility of using their findings to predict climate, soil, and fruitfulness.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Tree Physiology
